Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

Post._content: # ICT-6 [toc] ## OSPF ### **OSPF** - **OSPF** 1.DRBDRDRBDR224.0.0.5224.0.0.6 2.DR**** 3.SerialPPP 4. 5.OSPF224.0.0.5OSPFDROther****DRBDR224.0.0.6 ```shell # todo OSPF [R3]int s2/0/0 [R3-Serial2/0/0]ospf network-type ? broadcast Specify OSPF broadcast network nbma Specify OSPF NBMA network p2mp Specify OSPF point-to-multipoint network p2p Specify OSPF point-to-point network [R3-Serial2/0/0]ospf network-type ``` ### **** Virtual LinkABR() ABRVirtual-Link - **STEP1** - **STEP2** ```shell # todo OSPF [R]dis ospf peer ``` ```shell # todo AR2RID [R2]ospf [R2-ospf-1] [R2-ospf-1]dis ospf peer OSPF Process 1 with Router ID 10.0.2.2 Neighbors Area 0.0.0.0 interface 12.1.1.2(GigabitEthernet0/0/0)'s neighbors Router ID: 10.0.1.1 Address: 12.1.1.1 State: Full Mode:Nbr is Slave Priority: 1 DR: 12.1.1.2 BDR: 12.1.1.1 MTU: 0 Dead timer due in 40 sec Retrans timer interval: 5 Neighbor is up for 00:06:24 Authentication Sequence: [ 0 ] Neighbors Area 0.0.0.1 interface 23.1.1.2(GigabitEthernet0/0/1)'s neighbors Router ID: 10.0.3.3 Address: 23.1.1.3 State: Full Mode:Nbr is Master Priority: 1 DR: 23.1.1.3 BDR: 23.1.1.2 MTU: 0 Dead timer due in 30 sec Retrans timer interval: 5 Neighbor is up for 00:06:19 Authentication Sequence: [ 0 ] [R2-ospf-1]a 1 [R2-ospf-1-area-0.0.0.1]vlink-peer 10.0.3.3 # RID # todo AR3RID [R3]ospf [R3-ospf-1]a 1 [R3-ospf-1-area-0.0.0.1]dis ospf peer OSPF Process 1 with Router ID 10.0.3.3 Neighbors Area 0.0.0.1 interface 23.1.1.3(GigabitEthernet0/0/0)'s neighbors Router ID: 10.0.2.2 Address: 23.1.1.2 State: Full Mode:Nbr is Slave Priority: 1 DR: 23.1.1.3 BDR: 23.1.1.2 MTU: 0 Dead timer due in 31 sec Retrans timer interval: 5 Neighbor is up for 00:07:30 Authentication Sequence: [ 0 ] Neighbors Area 0.0.0.2 interface 34.1.1.3(GigabitEthernet0/0/1)'s neighbors Router ID: 34.1.1.4 Address: 34.1.1.4 State: Full Mode:Nbr is Master Priority: 1 DR: 34.1.1.3 BDR: 34.1.1.4 MTU: 0 Dead timer due in 39 sec Retrans timer interval: 5 Neighbor is up for 00:04:02 Authentication Sequence: [ 0 ] [R3-ospf-1-area-0.0.0.1]vlink-peer 10.0.2.2 # RID ``` 2101**RID** ### **LSA** - LSA LSA11LSA6 | | | | | ---- | ----------- | -------------- | | 1 | LSA | OSPF | | 2 | LSA | OSPF | | 3 | LSA | OSPF | | 4 | ASBRLSA | OSPF | | 5 | ASLSA | O_ASE | | 7 | NSSALSA | O_NSSA | **LSA**(Link-State Advertisement) **LSACK**(Link-State Acknowledge) ```shell # todo reset ospf process ``` ```shell # todo OSPFLSA1 display ospf lsdb router ``` ```shell # todo OSPFLSDBLSA2 dis ospf lsdb network ``` ```shell # todo OSPFLSA3 [R6]display ospf lsdb summary ``` ```shell # todo OSPFLAS4 [R6]show ip ospf border-routers [R1]show ip ospf database asbr-summary ``` ```shell # todo OSPFLSA5 [R6]display ospf lsdb ase ``` **LSDB()** DRBDRPC 1LSA 2LSADR 3LSAABR 4LSAABRASBR5LSA 5LSAASBR 6LSA 7LSANSSAASBRNSSANSAAABR75 OSPF() = (100M) / `bandwith-reference 1000` ### **** **** 1cost 2cost() ```shell # show [ospf-1]import-route rip 1 type 1 cost 50 RIP1cost [ospf-1]import-route rip 1 type 2 cost 50 RIP2cost [g0/0/0]ospf cost 10 OSPFcost ``` - **STEP1** - **STEP2** IP() - **STEP3** ```shell # todo AR5RIPOSPF [AR5]rip [AR5-rip-1]import-route ospf # todo AR5OSPFRIP [AR5]ospf [AR5-ospf-1]import-route rip ``` ASBR Adv rtr ### **** - **STEP1** - **STEP2.1** ```shell # todo AR4 [AR4]int lo 0 [AR4-LoopBack0]ip add 14.1.4.1 255.255.255.0 [AR4-LoopBack0]ip add 14.1.5.1 255.255.255.0 sub [AR4-LoopBack0]ip add 14.1.6.1 255.255.255.0 sub [AR4-LoopBack0]ip add 14.1.7.1 255.255.255.0 sub ``` - python  `yield` ** `yield` **

```python {.line-numbers}
def consumer(name):
    print(f"{name} is consuming.")
    while True:
        money = yield
        print("[%s] consumed %d ." % (name, money))

def producer(times=5):
    next(con1)
    next(con2)
    for n in range(1, times):
        con1.send(n)
        con2.send(n)
        print("\033[32;1m[producer]\033[0m is producing %s ." % (n))
 
if __name__ == '__main__':
    con1 = consumer("customer1")
    con2 = consumer("customer2")
    p = producer(5)
```

Thread ```python import time from threading import Thread class MyThread(Thread): def __init__(self, target, name): super().__init__() self.target = target self.name = name def run(self): self.target(self.name) time.sleep(0.5) def say_hi(name): print(f"hello, this's {name}") def main(): mythread = MyThread(target=say_hi, name="my thread") mythread.start() mythread.join() if __name__ == "__main__": main() ``` > 1.`run()` - ```python import os, time import threading from threading import Thread from multiprocessing import Process def work(): global n n = 0 if __name__ == '__main__': n = 100 p = Process(target=work) p.start() p.join() print(' n = ', n) n = 1 t = Thread(target=work) t.start() t.join() print(' n = ', n) ``` > 1.pn0n100 2.n0 - socket server ```python #_*_coding:utf-8_*_ #!/usr/bin/env python import threading import multiprocessing import socket s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET,socket.SOCK_STREAM) s.bind(('127.0.0.1',8080)) s.listen(5) def action(conn): while True: data=conn.recv(1024) print(data) conn.send(data.upper()) if __name__ == '__main__': while True: conn,addr=s.accept() p=threading.Thread(target=action,args=(conn,)) p.start() ``` client ```python #_*_coding:utf-8_*_ #!/usr/bin/env python import socket s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET,socket.SOCK_STREAM) s.connect(('127.0.0.1',8080)) while True: msg = input('>>: ').strip() if not msg:continue s.send(msg.encode('utf-8')) data = s.recv(1024) print(data) ``` -  - Condition Condition ProducerConsumerProducer10Consumer Consumer`gCondition.wait()`.Producer`gCondition.notify_all()` ```python {.line-numbers} import time, random from threading import Thread, Lock, RLock, Condition, current_thread g_money = 1000 g_condition = Condition() g_times = 0 g_totaltimes = 10 class Producer(Thread): def __init__(self, name): super().__init__() self.name = name def run(self): global g_money global g_times while True: money = random.randint(100, 1000) g_condition.acquire() # if g_times >= g_totaltimes: g_condition.release() break g_money += money print(f"{current_thread()}{money}{g_money}") g_times += 1 g_condition.notify_all() # g_condition.release() # time.sleep(0.5) class Consumer(Thread): def __init__(self, name): super().__init__() self.name = name def run(self): global g_money while True: price = random.randint(500, 1000) g_condition.acquire() # while g_money < price: if g_times >= g_totaltimes: g_condition.release() return print(f"{current_thread()}{price}{g_money}") g_condition.wait() # g_money -= price print(f"{current_thread()}{price}{g_money}") g_condition.release() # time.sleep(0.5) if __name__ == "__main__": for x in range(3): # t = Consumer(name=f"consumer{x}") t.start() for x in range(5): # t = Producer(name=f"producer{x}") t.start() ``` `g_condition.acquire()` `g_condition.wait()` --- ### `threading.Semaphore` --- ### `threading.Event` --- ### `threading.Timer` --- ### `threading.Barrier` --- ### `threading.loacl` - outline - **local** - **local** - **local**

import os, time
import threading
from threading import Thread

def loop():
    time.sleep(0.5)
    loop_thread = threading.current_thread()
    print(f" {loop_thread.name} ......")
    print(f" {loop_thread.name} PID{os.getpid()}")
    print(f" {loop_thread.name} TID{loop_thread.native_id}")
    print(f" {loop_thread.name} ......")

def main():
    main_thread = threading.current_thread()
    print(f" {main_thread.name} ......")
    print(f" {main_thread.name} PID{os.getpid()}")
    print(f" {main_thread.name} TID{main_thread.native_id}")
    
    t1 = Thread(target=loop, name="Loopthread-1", )
    t2 = Thread(target=loop, name="Loopthread-2", )
    
    t1.start()
    t2.start()

    t1.join()
    t2.join()

    print(f" {main_thread.name} ......")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

import time
from threading import Thread

class MyThread(Thread):

    def __init__(self, target, name):
        super().__init__()
        self.target = target
        self.name = name

    def run(self):
        self.target(self.name)
        time.sleep(0.5)

def say_hi(name):
    print(f"hello, this's {name}")

def main():
    mythread = MyThread(target=say_hi, name="my thread")
    mythread.start()
    mythread.join()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

import socket
s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET,socket.SOCK_STREAM)

    while True:
        data=conn.recv(1024)

        conn.send(data.upper())
 
if __name__ == '__main__':

    while True:
        conn,addr=s.accept()
        p=threading.Thread(target=action,args=(conn,))
        p.start()

import time
import threading

lock_apple = threading.Lock()
lock_banana = threading.Lock()

class MyThread(threading.Thread):

    def __init__(self):
        threading.Thread.__init__(self)

    def run(self):
        self.fun1()
        self.fun2()

    def fun1(self):
        lock_apple.acquire()  # ,,
        print (" %s , : %s--%s" %(self.name, "", time.ctime()))
        lock_banana.acquire()
        print (" %s , : %s--%s" %(self.name, "", time.ctime()))

        lock_banana.release()
        print (" %s , : %s--%s" %(self.name, "", time.ctime()))
        lock_apple.release()
        print (" %s , : %s--%s" %(self.name, "", time.ctime()))

    def fun2(self):
        lock_banana.acquire()
        print (" %s , : %s--%s" %(self.name, "", time.ctime()))

        time.sleep(0.1)  # 
        lock_apple.acquire()
        print (" %s , : %s--%s" %(self.name, "", time.ctime()))

        lock_apple.release()
        print (" %s , : %s--%s" %(self.name, "", time.ctime()))

        lock_banana.release()
        print (" %s , : %s--%s" %(self.name, "", time.ctime()))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    for i in range(5):  # 5
        my_thread = MyThread()
        my_thread.start()

import time, random
from threading import Thread, Lock, RLock, Condition, current_thread

g_money = 1000
g_condition = Condition()
g_times = 0
g_totaltimes = 10

class Producer(Thread):
    def __init__(self, name):
        super().__init__()
        self.name = name

    def run(self):
        global g_money
        global g_times
        while True:
            money = random.randint(100, 1000)
            g_condition.acquire()        # 
            if g_times >= g_totaltimes:
                g_condition.release()
                break
            g_money += money
            print(f"{current_thread()}{money}{g_money}")
            g_times += 1
            g_condition.notify_all()     # 
            g_condition.release()        # 
            time.sleep(0.5)

class Consumer(Thread):
    def __init__(self, name):
        super().__init__()
        self.name = name

    def run(self):
        global g_money
        while True:
            price = random.randint(500, 1000)
            g_condition.acquire()            # 
            while g_money < price:
                if g_times >= g_totaltimes:
                    g_condition.release()
                    return
                print(f"{current_thread()}{price}{g_money}")
                g_condition.wait()           # 
            g_money -= price
            print(f"{current_thread()}{price}{g_money}")
            g_condition.release()            # 
            time.sleep(0.5)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    for x in range(3):  # 
        t = Consumer(name=f"consumer{x}")
        t.start()
    for x in range(5):  # 
        t = Producer(name=f"producer{x}")
        t.start()

g_condition.acquire() g_condition.wait()

    print(f"thread foo is alive {t2.is_alive()}")

t.start()

import time, random
from threading import Thread, Lock, RLock, Condition, current_thread

g_money = 1000
g_condition = Condition()
g_times = 0
g_totaltimes = 10

class Producer(Thread):
    def __init__(self, name):
        super().__init__()
        self.name = name

    def run(self):
        global g_money
        global g_times
        while True:
            money = random.randint(100, 1000)
            g_condition.acquire()        # 
            if g_times >= g_totaltimes:
                g_condition.release()
                break
            g_money += money
            print(f"{current_thread()}{money}{g_money}")
            g_times += 1
            g_condition.notify_all()     # 
            g_condition.release()        # 
            time.sleep(0.5)

class Consumer(Thread):
    def __init__(self, name):
        super().__init__()
        self.name = name

    def run(self):
        global g_money
        while True:
            price = random.randint(500, 1000)
            g_condition.acquire()            # 
            while g_money < price:
                if g_times >= g_totaltimes:
                    g_condition.release()
                    return
                print(f"{current_thread()}{price}{g_money}")
                g_condition.wait()           # 
            g_money -= price
            print(f"{current_thread()}{price}{g_money}")
            g_condition.release()            # 
            time.sleep(0.5)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    for x in range(3):  # 
        t = Consumer(name=f"consumer{x}")
        t.start()
    for x in range(5):  # 
        t = Producer(name=f"producer{x}")
        t.start()

g_condition.acquire() g_condition.wait()

import threading

local_school = threading.local()  # ThreadLocal

def process_student():  # student
    std = local_school.student
    print('Hello, %s (in %s)' % (std, threading.current_thread().name))

def process_thread(name):  # ThreadLocalstudent
    local_school.student = name
    process_student()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    t1 = threading.Thread(target=process_thread, args=('Alice',), name='Thread-A')
    t2 = threading.Thread(target=process_thread, args=('Bob',), name='Thread-B')

    t2.start()

    t2.join()

# fbprophet [toc] ## 1. fbprophet ### 1.1. fbprophet Prophet Facebook fbprophetProphet prophet ++ pyStan Github[https://github.com/facebook/prophet](https://github.com/facebook/prophet) [https://github.com/facebook/prophet](https://facebook.github.io/prophet/) Forecasting at scale[https://github.com/facebook/prophet](https://peerj.com/preprints/3190/) ### 1.2. fbprophet - **** - ARIMA automated ARIMA - - - --- - **prophet***Modeling**Forecast Evaluation**Surface Problems* *Visually Inspect Forecasts* ![fbprophet_framework](./fbprophet_framework.png) - *Modeling* - *Forecast Evaluation* - *Surface Problems* - *Visually Inspect Forecasts* --- - **prophet** a. **** b. **** c. **** d. **** e. **** f. **** --- - ****growth seasonality holidays $$y(t) = g(t) + s(t) + h(t) + \epsilon_t$$ - $g(t)$ - $s(t)$/ - $h(t)$ - $\epsilon_t$ --- - **$g(t)$ (growth)** **Non-linear growth** **Linear growth**
- 1. **Non-linear growth** ${\large g(t) = \frac{C}{1 + e^{-k(t - b)}}}$
$C$ $k$ $b$ $C=1,k=1,m=0$ sigmoid Prophet $C=C(t), k=k(t), m=m(t)$

1 $C$ $C(t) = K$ $C(t) = Mt + K$ $C(t)$
2 Prophet 1. `n_changepoints`2. $S$ $s_j \ (1 \le j \le S)$ $\delta \in \mathbb{R}^S$ $\delta_j$ $s_j$ $k$ $t$ $k + \sum_{j: \ t > s_j}^{}{\delta_j}$ $a(t) \in \{0, 1\}^S$ $a_j(t) = \begin{cases}1,&if \ t \ge s_j\\0,&otherwise\end{cases}$ $t$ $k + a^T\delta$ $k=k(t)$
3 $m$ ${\large \gamma_j = (s_j - m - \sum_{l < j}^{}{\gamma_l})(1 - \frac{k + \sum_{l < j}^{}{\delta_l}}{k + \sum_{l \le j}^{}{\delta_l}})}$ $m=m(t)$
${\large g(t) = \frac{C(t)}{1 + e^{-(k + a(t)^t\delta)(t - (m + a(t)^T\gamma))}}}$ $a(t) = (a_1(t), \dots, a_S(t))^T, \delta = (\delta_1, \dots, \delta_S)^T, \gamma = (\gamma_1, \dots, \gamma_S)^T$
- 2. **Linear growth** ${\large g(t) = (k + a(t)\delta)t + (m + a(t)^T\gamma)}$ $k$ $\delta$ $m$ $\gamma = (\gamma_1, \dots, \gamma_S)^T, \gamma_j = -s_j\delta_j$ --- - **$s(t)$ (seasonality)** $$f(x) = a_0 + \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}{(a_n \ cos(nx) + b_n \ sin(nx))}, T = 2\pi$$ Prophet $P$ $P = 365.25$ $P = 7$ $$s(t) = \sum_{n = 1}^{N}{\left( a_n \ cos(\frac{2 \pi n t}{P}) + b_n \ cos(\frac{2 \pi n t}{P}) \right)}$$ Prophet $P = 365.25$$N = 10$ $P = 7$$N = 3$ $$\beta = (a_1, b_1, \dots, a_N, b_N)^T$$ $N = 10$ $$X(t) = \left[cos(\frac{2 \pi (1) t}{365.25}), \dots, sin(\frac{2 \pi (10) t}{365.25}) \right]$$ $N = 3$ $$X(t) = \left[cos(\frac{2 \pi (1) t}{7}), \dots, sin(\frac{2 \pi (3) t}{7}) \right]$$ ${\large s(t) = X(t) \beta, \ \beta \sim N(0, \sigma^2)}$ $\sigma$ = `seasonality_prior_scale`$\sigma$ $\sigma$ `seasonality_mode` `"additive"` () `"multiplicative"` $X(t)$ `fourier_series` --- - **$h(t)$ (holidays and events)** $i$ $D_i$ $\kappa_i$ $L$ ${\large h(t) = Z(t) \kappa = \sum_\limits{i = 1}^{L}\kappa_i \cdot 1_{ { t \in D_i } } }$ $Z(t) = (1_{ { t \in D_1 } }, \dots, 1_{ { t \in D_L} }), \ \kappa = (\kappa_1, \dots, \kappa_L)^T, \ \kappa \sim N(0, \upsilon^2)$ $\upsilon$ = `holidays_prior_scale` 10 --- - **$\epsilon_t$ ** --- - **fbprophet** 1) 2) fbprophet 3) fbprophet 4) + Trend 5) 6) 7) --- - **** 1. outlier `None` Prophet 2. log `growth='logistic'` log 3. `changepoint` 4. 5. `holiday` `holiday` 6. `seasonality_prior_scale``holidays_prior_scale``changepoint_prior_scale` 7. `growth` `seasonality` 8. `None` 9. `changepoint` - a. `growth``seasonality` - b. NA - c. `changepoint` --- ## fbprophet ### ```python import numpy as np import pandas as pd from fbprophet import Prophet df = pd.read_excel('example_wp_log_peyton_manning.xlsx') df['y'] = np.log(df['y']) playoffs = pd.DataFrame({ 'holiday': 'playoff', 'ds': pd.to_datetime([ '2008-01-13', '2009-01-03', '2010-01-16', '2010-01-24', '2010-02-07', '2011-01-08', '2013-01-12', '2014-01-12', '2014-01-19', '2014-02-02', '2015-01-11', '2016-01-17', '2016-01-24', '2016-02-07']), 'lower_window': 0, 'upper_window': 1, }) superbowls = pd.DataFrame({ 'holiday': 'superbowl', 'ds': pd.to_datetime(['2010-02-07', '2014-02-02', '2016-02-07']), 'lower_window': 0, 'upper_window': 1, }) holidays = pd.concat((playoffs, superbowls)) # m = Prophet(holidays=holidays) # m.fit(df) # future = m.make_future_dataframe(freq='D', periods=365) # forecast = m.predict(future) m.plot(forecast).show() # ``` Prophet sciket-klearn API `fit()` `DataFrame` `ds` `y` `yhat_upper` `yhat_lower` `interval_width` `forecasts` `keys` `_upper` `_lower` `predict()` `DataFrame` `ds` `yhat` `yhat_lower` `yhat_upper` trendholidaysweekly yearly `holidays` `yearly` `seasonality_prior_scale` ### `Prophet()`
```python class Prophet(object): """Prophet forecaster. Parameters ---------- growth: String 'linear' or 'logistic' to specify a linear or logistic trend. changepoints: List of dates at which to include potential changepoints. If not specified, potential changepoints are selected automatically. n_changepoints: Number of potential changepoints to include. Not used if input `changepoints` is supplied. If `changepoints` is not supplied, then n_changepoints potential changepoints are selected uniformly from the first `changepoint_range` proportion of the history. changepoint_range: Proportion of history in which trend changepoints will be estimated. Defaults to 0.8 for the first 80%. Not used if `changepoints` is specified. Not used if input `changepoints` is supplied. yearly_seasonality: Fit yearly seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate. weekly_seasonality: Fit weekly seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate. daily_seasonality: Fit daily seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate. holidays: pd.DataFrame with columns holiday (string) and ds (date type) and optionally columns lower_window and upper_window which specify a range of days around the date to be included as holidays. lower_window=-2 will include 2 days prior to the date as holidays. Also optionally can have a column prior_scale specifying the prior scale for that holiday. seasonality_mode: 'additive' (default) or 'multiplicative'. seasonality_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the strength of the seasonality model. Larger values allow the model to fit larger seasonal fluctuations, smaller values dampen the seasonality. Can be specified for individual seasonalities using add_seasonality. holidays_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the strength of the holiday components model, unless overridden in the holidays input. changepoint_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the flexibility of the automatic changepoint selection. Large values will allow many changepoints, small values will allow few changepoints. mcmc_samples: Integer, if greater than 0, will do full Bayesian inference with the specified number of MCMC samples. If 0, will do MAP estimation. interval_width: Float, width of the uncertainty intervals provided for the forecast. If mcmc_samples=0, this will be only the uncertainty in the trend using the MAP estimate of the extrapolated generative model. If mcmc.samples>0, this will be integrated over all model parameters, which will include uncertainty in seasonality. uncertainty_samples: Number of simulated draws used to estimate uncertainty intervals. """ def __init__( self, growth='linear', changepoints=None, n_changepoints=25, changepoint_range=0.8, yearly_seasonality='auto', weekly_seasonality='auto', daily_seasonality='auto', holidays=None, seasonality_mode='additive', seasonality_prior_scale=10.0, holidays_prior_scale=10.0, changepoint_prior_scale=0.05, mcmc_samples=0, interval_width=0.80, uncertainty_samples=1000, ): ```
- `Prophet()` - `growth`: `"linear"` `"logistic"` - `changepoints`: `changepoints=["2014-01-01"]` `'2014-01-01'` `changepoints` - `n_changepoints`: `changepoints` `changepoints` `changepoints` $80\%$ $25$ `n_changepoints` - `changepoint_range`: `changepoints` - `yearly_seasonality`: `True` $10$`yearly_trend, yearly_upper, yearly_lower` - `weekly_seasonality`: `True` $10$`weekly_trend, weekly_upper, weekly_lower` - `daily_seasonality`: `True` $10$`daily_trend, daily_upper, daily_lower` - `holidays`: `DataFrame` `holiday` (`string`) `ds` (`date`) `lower_window` `upper_window` `lower_window` `upper_window` `lower_window = -2` $2$ `None` - `seasonality_mode`: `"additive"`(default) or `"multiplicative"` - `seasonality_prior_scale`: - `holidays_prior_scale`: - `changepoint_prior_scale`: `changepoint` `changepoint` - `mcmc_samples`: mcmc $0$mcmc $0$ - `interval_width`: `mcmc_samples = 0` `mcmc_samples > 0` - `uncertainty_samples`: ### `make_future_dataframe()`
```python def make_future_dataframe(self, periods, freq='D', include_history=True): """Simulate the trend using the extrapolated generative model. Parameters ---------- periods: Int number of periods to forecast forward. freq: Any valid frequency for pd.date_range, such as 'D' or 'M'. include_history: Boolean to include the historical dates in the data frame for predictions. Returns ------- pd.Dataframe that extends forward from the end of self.history for the requested number of periods. """ ```
- `make_future_dataframe()` - `periods`: - `freq`: `'H'` `'D'` `'M'` - `include_history`: ### - STEP 1. `df = pd.DataFrame()` 2. `m = Prophet()` 3. `m.fit(df)` 4. / `future = pd.DataFrame()` / `future = m.make_future_dataframe()` 5. `forecast = m.predict(future)` 6. `m.plot(forecast )` `m.plot_components(forecast )` ```python # todo import numpy as np import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt from fbprophet import Prophet # todo data = pd.read_csv('./example_wp_log_peyton_manning.csv') # todo data.head() # todo df = df.rename(columns={'timestamp': 'ds', 'value': 'y'}) # todo 'timestamp' unixtime YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss df['ds'] = pd.to_datetime(df['ds'], unit='s') # todo df['y'] = (df['y'] - df['y'].mean()) / (df['y'].std()) # todo m = Prophet() # todo m.fit(df) # todo future = m.make_future_dataframe(periods=30, freq='M') """ periods30 freq'min' """ # todo future.tail() # todo forecast = m.predict(future) # todo m.plot(forecast) # todo m.plot_components(forecast) ``` - STEP 7. plotly ```python # todo import pandas as pd import plotly.express as px # todo df = forecast # todo df df.info df.info() df.head() df.describe() # todo fig = px.scatter( data_frame=df, x="ds", y=['yhat', "yhat_lower", "yhat_upper"], ) # todo fig.show() ``` ### - ```python m = Prophet(n_changepoints=25) m = Prophet(changepoint_range=0.8) m = Prophet(changepoint_prior_scale=0.05) m = Prophet(changepoints=['2014-01-01']) # from fbprophet.plot import add_changepoints_to_plot fig = m.plot(forecast) a = add_changepoints_to_plot(fig.gca(), m, forecast) ``` - ```python m = Prophet(weekly_seasonality=False) m.add_seasonality(name='monthly', period=30.5, fourier_order=5) m = Prophet(weekly_seasonality=True) m.add_seasonality(name='weekly', period=7, fourier_order=3, prior_scale=0.1) ``` - ```python playoffs = pd.DataFrame({ 'holiday': 'playoff', 'ds': pd.to_datetime(['2008-01-13', '2009-01-03', '2010-01-16', '2010-01-24', '2010-02-07', '2011-01-08', '2013-01-12', '2014-01-12', '2014-01-19', '2014-02-02', '2015-01-11', '2016-01-17', '2016-01-24', '2016-02-07']), 'lower_window': 0, 'upper_window': 1, }) superbowls = pd.DataFrame({ 'holiday': 'superbowl', 'ds': pd.to_datetime(['2010-02-07', '2014-02-02', '2016-02-07']), 'lower_window': 0, 'upper_window': 1, }) holidays = pd.concat((playoffs, superbowls)) m = Prophet(holidays=holidays, holidays_prior_scale=10.0) ``` ## [python fbprophet](https://www.cnblogs.com/hahahu/p/11753804.html) CSDN[python-fbprophet](https://blog.csdn.net/qq_23860475/article/details/81354467) + + [Facebookfbprophet](https://www.biaodianfu.com/fbprophet.html) [Facebook Prophet ](https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/52330017) [facebookprophet](https://www.cnblogs.com/bonelee/p/9577432.html) CSDN[R+pythonFacebookProphet](https://blog.csdn.net/sinat_26917383/article/details/57419862) [python](https://www.cnblogs.com/foley/p/5582358.html) Prophet

```python class Prophet(object): """Prophet forecaster. Parameters ---------- growth: String 'linear' or 'logistic' to specify a linear or logistic trend. changepoints: List of dates at which to include potential changepoints. If not specified, potential changepoints are selected automatically. n_changepoints: Number of potential changepoints to include. Not used if input `changepoints` is supplied. If `changepoints` is not supplied, then n_changepoints potential changepoints are selected uniformly from the first `changepoint_range` proportion of the history. changepoint_range: Proportion of history in which trend changepoints will be estimated. Defaults to 0.8 for the first 80%. Not used if `changepoints` is specified. Not used if input `changepoints` is supplied. yearly_seasonality: Fit yearly seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate. weekly_seasonality: Fit weekly seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate. daily_seasonality: Fit daily seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate. holidays: pd.DataFrame with columns holiday (string) and ds (date type) and optionally columns lower_window and upper_window which specify a range of days around the date to be included as holidays. lower_window=-2 will include 2 days prior to the date as holidays. Also optionally can have a column prior_scale specifying the prior scale for that holiday. seasonality_mode: 'additive' (default) or 'multiplicative'. seasonality_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the strength of the seasonality model. Larger values allow the model to fit larger seasonal fluctuations, smaller values dampen the seasonality. Can be specified for individual seasonalities using add_seasonality. holidays_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the strength of the holiday components model, unless overridden in the holidays input. changepoint_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the flexibility of the automatic changepoint selection. Large values will allow many changepoints, small values will allow few changepoints. mcmc_samples: Integer, if greater than 0, will do full Bayesian inference with the specified number of MCMC samples. If 0, will do MAP estimation. interval_width: Float, width of the uncertainty intervals provided for the forecast. If mcmc_samples=0, this will be only the uncertainty in the trend using the MAP estimate of the extrapolated generative model. If mcmc.samples>0, this will be integrated over all model parameters, which will include uncertainty in seasonality. uncertainty_samples: Number of simulated draws used to estimate uncertainty intervals. """ def __init__( self, growth='linear', changepoints=None, n_changepoints=25, changepoint_range=0.8, yearly_seasonality='auto', weekly_seasonality='auto', daily_seasonality='auto', holidays=None, seasonality_mode='additive', seasonality_prior_scale=10.0, holidays_prior_scale=10.0, changepoint_prior_scale=0.05, mcmc_samples=0, interval_width=0.80, uncertainty_samples=1000, ): ```

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from fbprophet import Prophet

df = pd.read_excel('example_wp_log_peyton_manning.xlsx')
df['y'] = np.log(df['y'])

playoffs = pd.DataFrame({
    'holiday': 'playoff',
    'ds': pd.to_datetime([
        '2008-01-13', '2009-01-03', '2010-01-16',
        '2010-01-24', '2010-02-07', '2011-01-08',
        '2013-01-12', '2014-01-12', '2014-01-19',
        '2014-02-02', '2015-01-11', '2016-01-17',
        '2016-01-24', '2016-02-07']),
    'lower_window': 0,
    'upper_window': 1,
})
superbowls = pd.DataFrame({
    'holiday': 'superbowl',
    'ds': pd.to_datetime(['2010-02-07', '2014-02-02', '2016-02-07']),
    'lower_window': 0,
    'upper_window': 1,
})
holidays = pd.concat((playoffs, superbowls))  # 
m = Prophet(holidays=holidays)  # 

m.fit(df)  # 

future = m.make_future_dataframe(freq='D', periods=365)  # 
forecast = m.predict(future)

m.plot(forecast).show()  #

class Prophet(object):
    """Prophet forecaster.

    Parameters
    ----------
    growth: String 'linear' or 'logistic' to specify a linear or logistic
        trend.
    changepoints: List of dates at which to include potential changepoints. If
        not specified, potential changepoints are selected automatically.
    n_changepoints: Number of potential changepoints to include. Not used
        if input `changepoints` is supplied. If `changepoints` is not supplied,
        then n_changepoints potential changepoints are selected uniformly from
        the first `changepoint_range` proportion of the history.
    changepoint_range: Proportion of history in which trend changepoints will
        be estimated. Defaults to 0.8 for the first 80%. Not used if
        `changepoints` is specified.
    Not used if input `changepoints` is supplied.
    yearly_seasonality: Fit yearly seasonality.
        Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
    weekly_seasonality: Fit weekly seasonality.
        Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
    daily_seasonality: Fit daily seasonality.
        Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
    holidays: pd.DataFrame with columns holiday (string) and ds (date type)
        and optionally columns lower_window and upper_window which specify a
        range of days around the date to be included as holidays.
        lower_window=-2 will include 2 days prior to the date as holidays. Also
        optionally can have a column prior_scale specifying the prior scale for
        that holiday.
    seasonality_mode: 'additive' (default) or 'multiplicative'.
    seasonality_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the strength of the
        seasonality model. Larger values allow the model to fit larger seasonal
        fluctuations, smaller values dampen the seasonality. Can be specified
        for individual seasonalities using add_seasonality.
    holidays_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the strength of the holiday
        components model, unless overridden in the holidays input.
    changepoint_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the flexibility of the
        automatic changepoint selection. Large values will allow many
        changepoints, small values will allow few changepoints.
    mcmc_samples: Integer, if greater than 0, will do full Bayesian inference
        with the specified number of MCMC samples. If 0, will do MAP
        estimation.
    interval_width: Float, width of the uncertainty intervals provided
        for the forecast. If mcmc_samples=0, this will be only the uncertainty
        in the trend using the MAP estimate of the extrapolated generative
        model. If mcmc.samples>0, this will be integrated over all model
        parameters, which will include uncertainty in seasonality.
    uncertainty_samples: Number of simulated draws used to estimate
        uncertainty intervals.
    """
    
    def __init__(
            self,
            growth='linear',
            changepoints=None,
            n_changepoints=25,
            changepoint_range=0.8,
            yearly_seasonality='auto',
            weekly_seasonality='auto',
            daily_seasonality='auto',
            holidays=None,
            seasonality_mode='additive',
            seasonality_prior_scale=10.0,
            holidays_prior_scale=10.0,
            changepoint_prior_scale=0.05,
            mcmc_samples=0,
            interval_width=0.80,
            uncertainty_samples=1000,
    ):

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from fbprophet import Prophet

df = pd.read_excel('example_wp_log_peyton_manning.xlsx')
df['y'] = np.log(df['y'])

playoffs = pd.DataFrame({
    'holiday': 'playoff',
    'ds': pd.to_datetime([
        '2008-01-13', '2009-01-03', '2010-01-16',
        '2010-01-24', '2010-02-07', '2011-01-08',
        '2013-01-12', '2014-01-12', '2014-01-19',
        '2014-02-02', '2015-01-11', '2016-01-17',
        '2016-01-24', '2016-02-07']),
    'lower_window': 0,
    'upper_window': 1,
})
superbowls = pd.DataFrame({
    'holiday': 'superbowl',
    'ds': pd.to_datetime(['2010-02-07', '2014-02-02', '2016-02-07']),
    'lower_window': 0,
    'upper_window': 1,
})
holidays = pd.concat((playoffs, superbowls))  # 
m = Prophet(holidays=holidays)  # 

m.fit(df)  # 

future = m.make_future_dataframe(freq='D', periods=365)  # 
forecast = m.predict(future)

m.plot(forecast).show()  #

Prophet() 


class Prophet(object):
    """Prophet forecaster.

    Parameters
    ----------
    growth: String 'linear' or 'logistic' to specify a linear or logistic
        trend.
    changepoints: List of dates at which to include potential changepoints. If
        not specified, potential changepoints are selected automatically.
    n_changepoints: Number of potential changepoints to include. Not used
        if input `changepoints` is supplied. If `changepoints` is not supplied,
        then n_changepoints potential changepoints are selected uniformly from
        the first `changepoint_range` proportion of the history.
    changepoint_range: Proportion of history in which trend changepoints will
        be estimated. Defaults to 0.8 for the first 80%. Not used if
        `changepoints` is specified.
    Not used if input `changepoints` is supplied.
    yearly_seasonality: Fit yearly seasonality.
        Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
    weekly_seasonality: Fit weekly seasonality.
        Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
    daily_seasonality: Fit daily seasonality.
        Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
    holidays: pd.DataFrame with columns holiday (string) and ds (date type)
        and optionally columns lower_window and upper_window which specify a
        range of days around the date to be included as holidays.
        lower_window=-2 will include 2 days prior to the date as holidays. Also
        optionally can have a column prior_scale specifying the prior scale for
        that holiday.
    seasonality_mode: 'additive' (default) or 'multiplicative'.
    seasonality_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the strength of the
        seasonality model. Larger values allow the model to fit larger seasonal
        fluctuations, smaller values dampen the seasonality. Can be specified
        for individual seasonalities using add_seasonality.
    holidays_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the strength of the holiday
        components model, unless overridden in the holidays input.
    changepoint_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the flexibility of the
        automatic changepoint selection. Large values will allow many
        changepoints, small values will allow few changepoints.
    mcmc_samples: Integer, if greater than 0, will do full Bayesian inference
        with the specified number of MCMC samples. If 0, will do MAP
        estimation.
    interval_width: Float, width of the uncertainty intervals provided
        for the forecast. If mcmc_samples=0, this will be only the uncertainty
        in the trend using the MAP estimate of the extrapolated generative
        model. If mcmc.samples>0, this will be integrated over all model
        parameters, which will include uncertainty in seasonality.
    uncertainty_samples: Number of simulated draws used to estimate
        uncertainty intervals.
    """
    
    def __init__(
            self,
            growth='linear',
            changepoints=None,
            n_changepoints=25,
            changepoint_range=0.8,
            yearly_seasonality='auto',
            weekly_seasonality='auto',
            daily_seasonality='auto',
            holidays=None,
            seasonality_mode='additive',
            seasonality_prior_scale=10.0,
            holidays_prior_scale=10.0,
            changepoint_prior_scale=0.05,
            mcmc_samples=0,
            interval_width=0.80,
            uncertainty_samples=1000,
    ):

make_future_dataframe() 


def make_future_dataframe(self, periods, freq='D', include_history=True):
    """Simulate the trend using the extrapolated generative model.

    Parameters
    ----------
    periods: Int number of periods to forecast forward.
    freq: Any valid frequency for pd.date_range, such as 'D' or 'M'.
    include_history: Boolean to include the historical dates in the data
        frame for predictions.

    Returns
    -------
    pd.Dataframe that extends forward from the end of self.history for the
    requested number of periods.
    """

import os, time
from multiprocessing import Process

def sub_process(arg1, arg2):
    print(f"......")
    print(f"PID{os.getpid()}PID{os.getppid()}")
    time.sleep(5)
    print(f"{(arg1, arg2)}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print(f"......")
    print(f"PID{os.getpid()}")
    print(f"......")
    p = Process(
        target=sub_process,
        args=("hello", 12),
    )
    print(f"......")
    p.start()
    print(f"......")
    p.join()
    print(f"......")
    print(f"......")

import os, time
from multiprocessing import Process

class MyProcess(Process):
    """ Process"""

    def __init__(self,arg1,arg2):
        super().__init__()
        self.arg1 = arg1
        self.arg2 = arg2

    def run(self):
        """runrun"""
        print(f"process name:{self.name}, PID:{self.pid},args:{(self.arg1, self.arg2)}")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    p = MyProcess(1, 2, 3, 4)
    p.start()

import os, time
from multiprocessing import Process

def daemon_process():
    global i_func
    while True:
        i_func += 1

def talk(conn,client_addr):

        try:
            msg=conn.recv(1024)
            if not msg:break
            conn.send(msg.upper())
        except Exception:
            break

if __name__ == '__main__': #windowsstart

        conn,client_addr=server.accept()
        p = Process(target=talk,args=(conn,client_addr))
        p.start()

def freeze_support():
    '''
    Run code for process object if this in not the main process
    '''
    if is_forking(sys.argv):
        kwds = {}
        for arg in sys.argv[2:]:
            name, value = arg.split('=')
            if value == 'None':
                kwds[name] = None
            else:
                kwds[name] = int(value)
        spawn_main(**kwds)
        sys.exit()

freeze_support()

def f():
    print('hello world!')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    freeze_support()
    Process(target=f).start()

import os, time, random
from multiprocessing import Process, Pipe

def producer(pipe):
    for product in products:
        print(':{}'.format(product))
        pipe.send(product)
        time.sleep(0.2)

def consumer(pipe):
    while True:
        try:
            item = pipe.recv()
            print(':{}'.format(item))
            time.sleep(0.2)
        except EOFError as e:
            print('')
            break

products = [random.randint(1, 10) for i in range(10)]
if __name__ == "__main__":
    pipe = Pipe(duplex=False)

    process_producer = Process(target=producer, args=(pipe[1],), )
    process_consumer = Process(target=consumer, args=(pipe[0],), )

    process_producer.start()
    process_consumer.start()

    pipe[0].close()
    pipe[1].close()

    process_producer.join()
    process_consumer.join()

import os, time, random
from multiprocessing import Process, Queue

def proc_put(q, data, proc_name):
    for dat in data:  # 
        try:
            q.put_nowait(dat)  # 
            print(f"{proc_name}{dat}")
        except:
            print(f"")
        time.sleep(0.1)

def proc_get(q, proc_name):
    while q.qsize():  # ()
        try:
            dat = q.get_nowait()  # 
            print(f"{proc_name}{dat}")
        except:
            print(f"")
        time.sleep(0.1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    q = Queue(5)
    data = [random.randint(1, 100) for i in range(10)]
    proc_send1 = Process(target=proc_put, args=(q, data, "process send1"))
    proc_recv1 = Process(target=proc_get, args=(q, "process recv1"))
    proc_recv2 = Process(target=proc_get, args=(q, "process recv2"))

    proc_send1.start()
    proc_recv1.start()
    proc_recv2.start()

    proc_send1.join()
    proc_recv1.join()
    proc_recv2.join()

import time, random
from multiprocessing import Process, JoinableQueue

def consumer(q, name):
    while True:
        food = q.get()
        time.sleep(random.uniform(0.2, 0.4))
        print('%s%s' % (name, food))
        q.task_done()  # 

def producer(q, name, food):
    for i in range(10):
        time.sleep(random.uniform(0.2, 0.4))
        print('%s%s%s' % (name, food, i + 1))
        q.put(food + str(i))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    q = JoinableQueue()
    proc_con = Process(target=consumer, args=(q, 'con'))
    proc_prod = Process(target=producer, args=(q, 'pro', ''))
    proc_con.daemon = True  # join()
    proc_con.start()
    proc_prod.start()
    # proc_con.join()        # join()
    proc_prod.join()         # 
    q.join()                 # (task_done)

    for p in proc:

import random, time, queue
from multiprocessing.managers import BaseManager


def start_worker(host, port, authkey):
    # BaseManagerqueue
    BaseManager.register('get_task_queue')
    BaseManager.register('get_result_queue')
    print ('Connect to server %s' % host)
    # portauthkeymanager
    worker = BaseManager(address=(host, port), authkey=authkey)
    # manager
    worker.connect()
    return worker


def get_queue(worker):
    task = worker.get_task_queue()
    result = worker.get_result_queue()
    # taskresult
    while 1:
        if task.empty():
            time.sleep(1)
            continue
        n = task.get(timeout=1)
        print ('worker get %d' % n)
        result.put(n)
        time.sleep(1)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    host = '127.0.0.1'
    port = 5000
    authkey = 'abc'
    # worker
    worker = start_worker(host, port, authkey.encode())
    # 
    get_queue(worker)

import os, time
from multiprocessing import Process

class MyProcess(Process):
    """ Process"""

    def __init__(self,arg1,arg2):
        super().__init__()
        self.arg1 = arg1
        self.arg2 = arg2

        """runrun"""

import os, time
from multiprocessing import Process

def daemon_process():
    global i_func
    while True:
        i_func += 1
        time.sleep(0.2)
        print(f'{i_func}')

def com_process():
    print('......')
    time.sleep(1)

    p_d = Process(target=daemon_process)

            conn.send(msg.upper())
        except Exception:
            break

def freeze_support():
    '''
    Run code for process object if this in not the main process
    '''
    if is_forking(sys.argv):
        kwds = {}
        for arg in sys.argv[2:]:
            name, value = arg.split('=')
            if value == 'None':
                kwds[name] = None
            else:
                kwds[name] = int(value)
        spawn_main(**kwds)
        sys.exit()

freeze_support() 

from multiprocessing import Process, freeze_support

def f():
    print('hello world!')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    freeze_support()
    Process(target=f).start()

import os, time, random
from multiprocessing import Process, Pipe

def producer(pipe):
    for product in products:
        print(':{}'.format(product))
        pipe.send(product)
        time.sleep(0.2)

def consumer(pipe):
    while True:
        try:
            item = pipe.recv()
            print(':{}'.format(item))
            time.sleep(0.2)
        except EOFError as e:
            print('')
            break

products = [random.randint(1, 10) for i in range(10)]
if __name__ == "__main__":
    pipe = Pipe(duplex=False)

    process_producer = Process(target=producer, args=(pipe[1],), )
    process_consumer = Process(target=consumer, args=(pipe[0],), )

    process_producer.start()
    process_consumer.start()

    pipe[0].close()
    pipe[1].close()

    process_producer.join()
    process_consumer.join()

import os, time, random
from multiprocessing import Process, Queue

def proc_put(q, data, proc_name):
    for dat in data:  # 
        try:
            q.put_nowait(dat)  # 
            print(f"{proc_name}{dat}")
        except:
            print(f"")
        time.sleep(0.1)

def proc_get(q, proc_name):
    while q.qsize():  # ()
        try:
            dat = q.get_nowait()  # 
            print(f"{proc_name}{dat}")
        except:
            print(f"")
        time.sleep(0.1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    q = Queue(5)
    data = [random.randint(1, 100) for i in range(10)]
    proc_send1 = Process(target=proc_put, args=(q, data, "process send1"))
    proc_recv1 = Process(target=proc_get, args=(q, "process recv1"))
    proc_recv2 = Process(target=proc_get, args=(q, "process recv2"))

    proc_send1.start()
    proc_recv1.start()
    proc_recv2.start()

    proc_send1.join()
    proc_recv1.join()
    proc_recv2.join()

import time, random
from multiprocessing import Process, JoinableQueue

def consumer(q, name):
    while True:
        food = q.get()
        time.sleep(random.uniform(0.2, 0.4))
        print('%s%s' % (name, food))
        q.task_done()  # 

def producer(q, name, food):
    for i in range(10):
        time.sleep(random.uniform(0.2, 0.4))
        print('%s%s%s' % (name, food, i + 1))
        q.put(food + str(i))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    q = JoinableQueue()
    proc_con = Process(target=consumer, args=(q, 'con'))
    proc_prod = Process(target=producer, args=(q, 'pro', ''))
    proc_con.daemon = True  # join()
    proc_con.start()
    proc_prod.start()
    # proc_con.join()        # join()
    proc_prod.join()         # 
    q.join()                 # (task_done)

import random, time, queue
from multiprocessing.managers import BaseManager

# 
task_queue = queue.Queue()
# 
result_queue = queue.Queue()


# lambdapython2.7picklelambda
def get_task_queue():
    global task_queue
    return task_queue


# lambdapython2.7picklelambda
def get_result_queue():
    global task_queue
    return task_queue


def startManager(host, port, authkey):
    # QueuecallableQueue
    BaseManager.register('get_task_queue', callable=get_task_queue)
    BaseManager.register('get_result_queue', callable=get_result_queue)
    # host,portauthkey
    manager = BaseManager(address=(host, port), authkey=authkey)
    # manager
    manager.start()
    return manager


def put_queue(manager):
    # queueu
    task = manager.get_task_queue()
    while 1:
        n = random.randint(0, 1000)
        print ('Put task %d' % n)
        task.put(n)
        time.sleep(0.5)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    host = '127.0.0.1'
    port = 5000
    authkey = 'abc'
    # manager
    manager = startManager(host, port, authkey.encode())
    # task
    put_queue(manager)
    # 
    manager.shutdown()

# encoding:utf-8

import random, time, queue
from multiprocessing.managers import BaseManager


def start_worker(host, port, authkey):
    # BaseManagerqueue
    BaseManager.register('get_task_queue')
    BaseManager.register('get_result_queue')
    print ('Connect to server %s' % host)
    # portauthkeymanager
    worker = BaseManager(address=(host, port), authkey=authkey)
    # manager
    worker.connect()
    return worker


def get_queue(worker):
    task = worker.get_task_queue()
    result = worker.get_result_queue()
    # taskresult
    while 1:
        if task.empty():
            time.sleep(1)
            continue
        n = task.get(timeout=1)
        print ('worker get %d' % n)
        result.put(n)
        time.sleep(1)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    host = '127.0.0.1'
    port = 5000
    authkey = 'abc'
    # worker
    worker = start_worker(host, port, authkey.encode())
    # 
    get_queue(worker)
